thread.title: In Transit: Your Questions Answered: United Airlines Flight Delays
thread.title_full: In Transit: Your Questions Answered: United Airlines Flight Delays

author: STEPHANIE ROSENBLOOM
title: In Transit: Your Questions Answered: United Airlines Flight Delays
text: Continue reading the main story United Airlines flights were grounded Wednesday morning after the carrier experienced a system outage. Not long after the Federal Aviation Administration issued an advisory, however, it announced the ground stop was cancelled and that United’s automation issue had been resolved. United is telling customers through its Twitter feed (@United) that it is still recovering from the problem, which it has described as a “network connectivity issue.” This is not the first computer problem the company has had lately that has resulted in delays. Travelers are being encouraged to check their flight status on United.com before leaving for the airport. United’s toll-free customer service line is experiencing hold times that are longer than usual, though a reporter’s estimated wait time to speak with an agent was seven minutes.
